official-title.#text:
Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States Postal Service should
			 take all appropriate measures to ensure the continuation of door delivery
			 for all business and residential customers.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
should
			 take all appropriate measures to ensure the continuation of door delivery
			 for all businesses and residential customers.

text.#text: That it is the sense of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has announced that it may need to eliminate or reduce
			 levels of door-to-door delivery service by the conversion of millions of
			 homes and businesses to centralized delivery or curbside and require those
			 who wish to retain their door service to pay a delivery tax;

text.#text:
Whereas reduced levels of service will have an immediate impact on current year revenue and a
			 long-term impact on the viability of a business inevitably causing a
			 larger drop in revenue from service cuts than from the estimated savings
			 of elimination or reducing door delivery;

Whereas door delivery is a vital service that the American people have relied on since the 1860s in
			 both rural and urban areas and ensures the security of mail and packages;

Whereas voluntary conversion of businesses in 2013 equated to a mere 0.8 percent of voluntary
			 conversions confirming that businesses depend on in-person contact with
			 letter carriers to ensure transactional security and initiate new business
			 and revenue for the

Whereas millions of Americans will be forced to retrieve their daily mail and packages from a
			 centralized location removing the daily convenience for Americans in
			 receiving checks, medications and other essential items; and

Whereas eliminating or reducing door delivery services will serve as a hindrance for the elderly
			 and disabled who will be forced to retrieve their mail and packages and be
			 required to submit to a cumbersome application process in order to opt out
			 of the requirement: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 711 IH: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States Postal Service should take all appropriate measures to ensure the continuation of door delivery for all business and residential customers.
